newsitem.title: USA: SPSS Inc Q1 revs cut buy foreign exchange.
newsitem.headline: SPSS Inc Q1 revs cut buy foreign exchange.

text.p: SPSS Inc, a multinational software company, said Wednesday that foreign exchange rates hurt first quarter revenues.

The company reported revenues of $22.2 million for the quarter, up about 10 percent from $20.1 million a year ago. But without foreign exchange considerations, revenues would have risen 14 percent, the company said.
SPSS also said it will release its Smart Viewer product, which will allow users to share live reports and graphics via the Internet, e-mail and diskette, in the second quarter.
Earlier Wednesday, the company reported net income of $2.5 million, or $0.29 a share, for the first quarter, compared with $1.9 million, or $0.23 a share, a year ago.
SPSS shares were down 3/4 at 27-1/4 Wednesday.
